channel.title: Time Trial question
channel.description:
How does Time Trial program know how long i use it?
And how i remove the time counter it?

item.title: Time Trial question
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

They can do several different things - check a registry value, check the date on a specific file, write the install date to a file and read that, etc. I’d say you can bypass 90% of them by turning back your system clock after installation or by setting it WAY forward before installation (then setting it back to normal afterward).

If you actually want to remove it, you’ll need to learn assembly and do some editing.

Read full topic

item.title: Time Trial question
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:1, topic:70481”]How does Time Trial program know how long i use it?

And how i remove the time counter it?[/quote]

Usually it gets the install date, and compares it with the BIOS clock date.
